info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 2 at 2:55PM EDT until September 2 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Key West FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of the Lower Keys.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM EDT, National Weather Service Meteorologist detected heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sugarloaf Key, Upper Sugarloaf Key, Bay Point and Saddlebunch Keys. - This includes US 1 between mile markers 13 and 20. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
